channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Brave New Normal: Environmental groups imagine a post-pandemic world
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description:
Experts say that a post-COVID-19 world will not be the same one we knew before the pandemic hit.
Environmental groups give suggestions on what should be the “new normal” for the environment.

item.title: PNP chief defends Taguig condo incident: I stand by my commanders
item.description: "I trust my commanders because the chief of [NCR] police ruled that it is regular and he is supported by the regional director, so, personally, I stand by whatever decision the chief of police comes to," Gamboa said.

item.title: UP refutes reports on stranded construction workers who resorted to picking fruits, eating stray animals
item.description: “The OVCPD also inspected their supply room, which contained three sacks of rice (25 kilograms each) and canned goods from the All UP Workers Union and other organizations inside the campus,” UP said.

item.title: PhilHealth, Malasakit Centers maximizing resources for patients
item.description: Sen. Bong Go assured Filipinos that state-insurer Philippine Health Insurance Corp. is maximizing its resources to continue to help patients affected by the coronavirus disease 2019 pay their hospital bills.

item.title: ‘Let POGOs resume for crisis response funds’
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Philippine offshore gaming operators should be allowed to resume their businesses to enable the government to raise needed revenue to address the impact of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic, a congressman proposed yesterday.

item.title: Israeli firm finds COVID-19 cure from placenta
item.description: A placenta-based cell therapy formulated by an Israeli therapeutic company has been found to have totally cured six critically ill coronavirus disease 2019 patients in Israel.

item.title: Infection among healthcare workers ‘worrisome’
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The World Health Organization has expressed concern over the high rates of healthcare workers contracting the coronavirus disease 2019 in the Philippines.

item.title: Trump offers Philippines more aid to fight COVID-19
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: United States President Donald Trump, in a phone call with President Duterte on Sunday, offered additional assistance to the Philippines as the country deals with the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: No total lockdown; Duterte decides on ECQ tomorrow
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: With the end of the enhanced community quarantine just eight days away, expect no total lockdown to follow, presidential spokesman Harry Roque said yesterday.

item.title: P246 billion savings to be used vs COVID
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: More than P240 billion in savings can be used for coronavirus response, President Duterte said on Monday, weeks after admitting that the government is getting “desperate” because of the need to spend huge sums in aid as state revenues shrink.
